head.title: It Takes a Skeptic to Ignore Global Warming;Dare to Speak Out

hedline.hl1: It Takes a Skeptic to Ignore Global Warming;Dare to Speak Out

block.p: Dr. Richard S. Lindzen's skepticism about the theory of global warming (Science Times, June 18) struck a familiar chord. I too have been skeptical of the notion that any significant warming of the earth will result from increases in certain trace gases in the atmosphere.

Dr. Richard S. Lindzen's skepticism about the theory of global warming (Science Times, June 18) struck a familiar chord. I too have been skeptical of the notion that any significant warming of the earth will result from increases in certain trace gases in the atmosphere.

After a local newspaper published my letter voicing such skepticism, a senior meteorologist at my institution objected that Federal funds for climate change research could be jeopardized if members of Congress were to read my letter and conclude that some atmospheric scientists are skeptical of the global warming theory. That encounter discouraged me from following lines of research that could substantiate my opinions.

Now that prominent scientists are speaking out about their doubts, I hope it will become professionally acceptable for junior scientists to pursue climate research that does not presume politically correct results. DEAN D. CHURCHILL Asst. Prof., Meteorology & Physical Oceanography, U. of Miami Miami, June 18, 1996
